page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: 1This area lies in the Brendon Hills and contains part of Clatworthy reservoir. The area is mostly farming with a little woodland, the farms being small. There is considerable evidence of rural depopulation and the remaining inhabitants have to go outside the area for shops, entertainments etc. The area is very picturesque, but is off the main tourist routes and so remains unspoilt countryside due partly to its inaccessability. The area contains only one large occupied house, Bittescombe Manor, the other buildings being fairly small farms. Generally the land has to be improved for grazing and there are areas that have reverted to their natural state.
